text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSMedicationPrescription

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSMedicationPrescription 0..*BaseMedication prescription model
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
header 1..1EHDSMedicationPrescriptionHeaderPrescription header
presentedForm 0..*EHDSAttachmentPresented Form
comment 0..*stringAdditional information or comments
prescriptionItem 1..*BasePresription line for one medication. In many countries, only one line is allowed. In case multiple medications are allowed, all lines need to be authored together.
identifier 0..1IdentifierIdentifier for a single line on prescription, if exists. In case of single-line prescription, this identifier is typically the same as prescription identifier.
medication 1..1EHDSMedicationPrescribed product, branded, generic, virtual, extemporal, etc
indication 0..*CodeableConceptReason for the prescription (typically diagnosis, or a procedure)
Binding Description: (preferred): shall we have a preferred binding here?
indicationText 0..1stringReason for the prescription in textual form. This might not be allowed by some implementations.
prescriptionIntent 0..1CodeableConceptIntent of the prescription - prophylaxis, treatment, anesthesia, etc
treatmentPeriod 0..1PeriodPeriod over which the medication is to be taken (in case of multiple dosaging schemes, this would be the overall period of all dosages.)
quantityPrescribed 0..1QuantityOverall quantity of prescribed product (e.g number of packages or number of tablets).
dosageInstructions 0..*EHDSDosagingDosaging and administration instructions
preparationInstructions 0..1stringAdditional instructions about preparation or dispense
substitution 0..1BaseWhether and which type of substitution is allowed for this medication treatment line
allowed[x] 0..1Whether and to what extent substitution is allowed.
allowedBooleanboolean
allowedCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
reason[x] 0..1Reason for the substitution requirement
reasonCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
reasonStringstring
status 1..1CodeableConceptStatus of the prescription, this should not be status of treatment
statusReason[x] 0..1Reason for the current status of prescription, for example the reason why the prescription was made invalid or why the prescription was changed from previous
statusReasonCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
statusReasonStringstring
repeatsAllowed 0..1integerNumber of refills authorized
minimumDispenseInterval 0..1DurationMinimum Dispense Interval
offLabel 0..1BaseIndicates that the prescriber has knowingly prescribed the medication for an indication, age group, dosage, or route of administration that is not approved by the regulatory agencies and is not mentioned in the prescribing information for the drug
isOffLabelUse 1..1booleanIndicates off-label use. Must be 'true' when .reason is provided.
reason[x] 0..*Reason or related clarification for off-label use
reasonCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
reasonStringstring
comment 0..*stringAdditional information or comments

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSMedicationPrescription
title: Medication prescription model
description: Logical model for medication prescription body. A prescription contains one or more prescription items.

element.short: Medication prescription model
element.definition: Logical model for medication prescription body. A prescription contains one or more prescription items.

element.short: Prescription header
element.definition: Prescription header data elements

element.short: Presented Form
element.definition: Entire prescription as issued. Various formats could be provided, pdf format is recommended.

element.short: Additional information or comments
element.definition: Additional information or comments

element.short: Presription line for one medication. In many countries, only one line is allowed. In case multiple medications are allowed, all lines need to be authored together.
element.definition: Presription line for one medication. In many countries, only one line is allowed. In case multiple medications are allowed, all lines need to be authored together.

element.short: Identifier for a single line on prescription, if exists. In case of single-line prescription, this identifier is typically the same as prescription identifier.
element.definition: Identifier for a single line on prescription, if exists. In case of single-line prescription, this identifier is typically the same as prescription identifier.

element.short: Prescribed product, branded, generic, virtual, extemporal, etc
element.definition: Prescribed product, branded, generic, virtual, extemporal, etc
element.comment: Medication model changed - described within that model

element.short: Reason for the prescription (typically diagnosis, or a procedure)
element.definition: Reason for the prescription (typically diagnosis, or a procedure)

binding.description: shall we have a preferred binding here?

element.short: Reason for the prescription in textual form. This might not be allowed by some implementations.
element.definition: Reason for the prescription in textual form. This might not be allowed by some implementations.

element.short: Intent of the prescription - prophylaxis, treatment, anesthesia, etc
element.definition: Intent of the prescription - prophylaxis, treatment, anesthesia, etc

element.short: Period over which the medication is to be taken (in case of multiple dosaging schemes, this would be the overall period of all dosages.)
element.definition: Period over which the medication is to be taken (in case of multiple dosaging schemes, this would be the overall period of all dosages.)
element.comment: Starting Date of Therapy A1.5.6. End date added.

element.short: Overall quantity of prescribed product (e.g number of packages or number of tablets).
element.definition: Overall quantity of prescribed product (e.g number of packages or number of tablets).

element.short: Dosaging and administration instructions
element.definition: Dosaging and administration instructions
element.comment: Dosage model significantly changed towards more granularity. A.1.5.3-A.1.5.7

element.short: Additional instructions about preparation or dispense
element.definition: Additional instructions about preparation or dispense

element.short: Whether and which type of substitution is allowed for this medication treatment line
element.definition: Whether and which type of substitution is allowed for this medication treatment line
element.comment: No change but subelements added. A 1.5.11

element.short: Whether and to what extent substitution is allowed.
element.definition: Whether and to what extent substitution is allowed.

element.short: Reason for the substitution requirement
element.definition: Reason for the substitution requirement

element.short: Status of the prescription, this should not be status of treatment
element.definition: Status of the prescription, this should not be status of treatment

element.short: Reason for the current status of prescription, for example the reason why the prescription was made invalid or why the prescription was changed from previous
element.definition: Reason for the current status of prescription, for example the reason why the prescription was made invalid or why the prescription was changed from previous

element.short: Number of refills authorized
element.definition: How many times the prescription item can be dispensed in addition to the original dispense.

element.short: Minimum Dispense Interval
element.definition: If a prescription allows for repeated dispensations, the interval between dispensations shall be stated here.
element.comment: Added, based on ISO 17532:2024 A.7.3 Minimum dispensing interval

element.short: Indicates that the prescriber has knowingly prescribed the medication for an indication, age group, dosage, or route of administration that is not approved by the regulatory agencies and is not mentioned in the prescribing information for the drug
element.definition: Indicates that the prescriber has knowingly prescribed the medication for an indication, age group, dosage, or route of administration that is not approved by the regulatory agencies and is not mentioned in the prescribing information for the drug

element.short: Indicates off-label use. Must be 'true' when .reason is provided.
element.definition: Indicates off-label use. Must be 'true' when .reason is provided.

element.short: Reason or related clarification for off-label use
element.definition: Reason or related clarification for off-label use

element.short: Additional information or comments
element.definition: Additional information or comments
